matrix-project.description:
builds bitstreams with many different configurations and tests this images on real HW in case of problems: please alexandre.castellane@fr.ibm.com
WARNING !!! ==> Default Vivado is 2018.1 =>> S121B card is not available for test => only binary generation are performed (no hw test) =>> TIMING reset to 100 for CAPI1 (with 5 loops) =>> Removed hls_intersect_s & hls_intersect_h tests ==> Removed hls_scatter_gather (too many RAM used)

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: BRANCH
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Choose the branch for https://github.com:open-power/snap you want to test. Please do not use wildcards!!

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: BUILD_NON_CLOUD
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: enable/disable the non_cloud image build flow

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: BUILD_CLOUD
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: enable/disable the cloud image build flow

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: TIMING_LABLIMIT_CHOICE
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: Choose the TIMING_LABLIMIT parameter for building images. If achieved timing is worst than your choice, the run will failed. Warning: -200ps is not easy to reach and needs several attempts (sometimes 5 attempts are not enough).

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: NO_TEST_CARDS
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The list of CAPI1.0 cards we do NOT want to HW test for different reasons (please see README for default reasons)

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: mopBoxes
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: List of Montpellier systems available for testing : - antipode: S822LC with 1 ADKU3 and 1 N250S - marennes: S822LC with 1 N250S and 1 AD8K5 (it needs to define capimop user with authorized_keys)

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash set +x echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "`date` BUILD START" echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "EXECUTING CAPI1.0 IMG FIRST SHELL FROM MOPJENKINS ..." echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "Hostname: `hostname`"; echo "ID: `id`" echo "Working dir is : $PWD" echo
#============================================================================================== # Variables
> export_props.properties NAME=$(echo $GIT_BRANCH| cut -d'/' -f 2 |tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]') # remove origin/ from branch and translate to lowercase PREFIX=$(echo $NAME| cut -d'_' -f 1) # chars up to first '_' identify need for test ACTION_TYPE=$(echo $ACT| cut -d'_' -f 1| tr '[:lower:]' '[:upper:]') CRD=$(echo $CRD_CL| cut -d'_' -f 1) # chars up to first '_' identify card CL=$(echo $CRD_CL| cut -d'_' -f 2) # chars behind first '_' identify Cloud build
echo "Build with Card=$CRD Action=$ACT Action_type=$ACTION_TYPE CLOUD_build=$CL branch_selected=$BRANCH git_branch=$NAME prefix=$PREFIX test_on_hw=$TEST_ON_HW"
EmailDestinationList=( fabrice_moyen@fr.ibm.com ) EmailOrNotEmail=0 # 0 means do not send emails; 1 means send email
HWUser="capimop"
#============================================================================================== # Functions
# Function for sending alerting emails # Example 1: SendAnEmail -s "This is the subject/alert" -d firstDest@gmail.com -d SecondDest@free.fr # Example 2: SendAnEmail -s "This is the subject/alert" -d "${EmailDestinationList[*]}" function SendAnEmail { local OPTIND opt DestList while getopts "s:d:" opt do case $opt in s) Subject="$OPTARG" ;; d) DestList+=("$OPTARG") ;; esac done
for i in ${DestList[@]} do echo "" | mail -s "$Subject" $i done }
#============================================================================================== # Do not run non-desired cases (action types, actions, cards) # This will lead to a brown colored result meaning : aborted
echo;echo "*******************************************************************************" echo "J: Do not run (abort) non-desired cases (action types, actions, cards)"
# BSKIP stands for board skip
BSKIP=0
if [ "${!ACTION_TYPE}" == "false" ]; then BSKIP=1; fi # if ACTION_TYPE="HLS", ${!ACTION_TYPE} is identical to $HLS if [ "${!CRD}" == "false" ]; then BSKIP=1; fi # if CRD="ADKU3", ${!CRD} is identical to $ADKU3 if [ "$CL" == "CL" ] && [ "$BUILD_CLOUD" == "false" ]; then BSKIP=1;fi if [ "$CL" == "nCL" ] && [ "$BUILD_NON_CLOUD" == "false" ]; then BSKIP=1;fi if [ "$ACT" == "test" ]; then BSKIP=0; fi # test action always run
echo "build(nCL,CL)=$BUILD_NON_CLOUD $BUILD_CLOUD action_types (hdl,hls)=$ACTION_TYPE enabled_cards=$CRD BSKIP=$BSKIP"
# ASKIP may stand for ACTION skip
# FAB: faire le tri dans ces cases case "$CRD:$ACT" in *:scatter_gather* ) C="scc1";ASKIP=1;; # no scatter_gather for CAPI1 cards N250S:*NVME* ) C="N2NV";ASKIP=0;; N250S:*nvme* ) C="N2nv";ASKIP=0;; *:hls_intersect_h ) C="inth";ASKIP=1;; *:hls_intersect_s ) C="ints";ASKIP=1;; *:hls_blowfish ) C="blow";ASKIP=1;; # no maintenance for blowfish * ) C="def ";ASKIP=0;; esac
echo "card=$CRD action=$ACT case=$C ASKIP=$ASKIP"
#============================================================================================== # Cleaning directories if ACT=test, # else checking $CRD.$ACT.defconfig file existence
echo;echo "*******************************************************************************"
if [ $ASKIP -eq 0 ] then
case "$ACT" in
test ) echo "J: ACT=test" gitnames=`git ls-remote https://github.com/open-power/snap|grep "refs/heads/"|awk '{print $2}'` echo "gitnames=$gitnames"
echo for dir in "/var/jenkins/workspace/SNAP_IMG_CAPI1_matrix"/*;do if [ -d "$dir" ];then branch="refs/heads/"`basename $dir` if [[ "$gitnames" =~ "$branch" ]];then echo "branch=$branch found in gitnames, keeping dir=$dir" else echo "branch=$branch not found in gitnames, deleting dir=\'$dir\'" rm -rf "$dir" # put in quotes to work for directories with blanks fi else echo "$dir is not a directory, continuing" fi done DSKIP=0 ;;
*"hls_intersect"* ) echo "J: ACT=$ACT => Checking snap/defconfig/$CRD.hls_intersect.defconfig existence" if [ -f snap/defconfig/$CRD.hls_intersect.defconfig ];then echo " --> OK" DSKIP=0 else echo;echo "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!" echo "$CRD.hls_intersect.defconfig does not exist" echo "Aborting..." echo;echo "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!" echo;echo "defconfig directory content:" echo "----------------------------" ls snap/defconfig/ DSKIP=1 fi ;;
* ) echo "J: Checking snap/defconfig/$CRD.$ACT.defconfig existence" if [ -f snap/defconfig/$CRD.$ACT.defconfig ];then echo " --> OK" DSKIP=0 else echo;echo "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!" echo "$CRD.$ACT.defconfig does not exist" echo "Aborting..." echo;echo "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!" echo;echo "defconfig directory content:" echo "----------------------------" echo "$CRD.$ACT.defconfig does not exist" ls snap/defconfig/ DSKIP=1 fi ;;
esac
echo;echo "defconfig SKIP=$DSKIP"
#============================================================================================== # Checking enough space is available
echo;echo "*******************************************************************************" echo "J: Checking enough space is available" echo #AFSused=`fs lq /afs/bb/proj/fpga/framework/CI_ws/SNAP_IMG_TEST_matrix/|grep -v Used|awk '{print $4}'|sed 's/%//g'|sed 's/<//g'` diskused=`df -h /var/jenkins/workspace/SNAP_IMG_CAPI1_matrix|grep -v Used|awk '{print $5}'|sed 's/%//g'|sed 's/<//g'` SSKIP=0;msg="disk usage =${diskused}%"
if (( diskused > 90 ));then msg="ERROR: $msg, stopping additional builds";SSKIP=1 if [ $EmailOrNotEmail -eq 1 ]; then SendAnEmail -s "ERROR: Disk space is used up to ${diskused}%, stopping additional builds" -d "${EmailDestinationList[*]}" #SendAnEmail -s "ERROR: AFS space is used up to ${AFSused}%, stopping additional builds" -d "${EmailDestinationList[*]}" fi
elif (( diskused > 70 ));then msg="WARNING: $msg" if [ $EmailOrNotEmail -eq 1 ]; then SendAnEmail -s "WARNING: Disk space is used up to ${diskused}%" -d "${EmailDestinationList[*]}" #SendAnEmail -s "WARNING: AFS space is used up to ${AFSused}%" -d "${EmailDestinationList[*]}" fi
else msg="OK: $msg" fi echo "$msg"
fi # end of if ASKIP
#============================================================================================== # Aborting if something went wrong
if [ "$ASKIP" == "1" ] || [ "$DSKIP" == "1" ] || [ "$BSKIP" == "1" ] || [ "$SSKIP" == "1" ];then SKIP=1;else SKIP=0;fi
#============================================================================================== # Passing parameters to next script
echo;echo "*******************************************************************************" echo "J: Forwarding parameters to next script" echo echo "SKIP=$SKIP" > export_props.properties echo "CRD=$CRD" >> export_props.properties echo "CL=$CL" >> export_props.properties echo "EmailDestinationList=( ${EmailDestinationList[*]} )" >> export_props.properties echo "EmailOrNotEmail=$EmailOrNotEmail" >> export_props.properties echo "HWUser=${HWUser}" >> export_props.properties
echo "properties forwarded to next shell:" cat export_props.properties echo;echo "*******************************************************************************" echo

#!/bin/bash

set +x # reduce Jenkins output ulimit -c unlimited # limit core dumps
echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "EXECUTING SECOND CAPI1 SHELL FROM MOPJENKINS ..." echo "****************************************************************************************"

TESTBOXES=( ${mopBoxes[*]} ) # init array of systems

RootSaveDir=/data/Images RootLogsDir=/data/LogsWhenFailed LogsDir=$RootLogsDir/$TARGET_DIR/hardware/logs PSLSE_BRANCH=master
CapiUtilsURL="https://github.com/ibm-capi/capi-utils.git"

IMGServers="jtagx86" # List of servers where to push generated images.
#echo "****************************************************************************************" #echo "J:LSF SETUP ..." #export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin:/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/bin #export LSF_SERVERDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/etc #export LSF_LIBDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/lib #export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/lib #export LSF_BINDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/bin #export LSF_SUBMITTER_OSTYPE=Linux #export LSF_ENVDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/conf #LSF="-P zsort" #LSF+=" -M 6" # 12GB memory #LSF+=" -C 2000" # 2MB core file #LSF+=' -R type=X86_64 -R span[hosts=1]' #LSF+=" -I -n 8"
# This variable is kept from CAPI2 cards having 2 SPI flash instead of a BPI (just in case) SPI8=0
#============================================================================================== # Functions
# Function for sending alerting emails # Example 1: SendAnEmail -s "This is the subject/alert" -d firstDest@gmail.com -d SecondDest@free.fr # Example 2: SendAnEmail -s "This is the subject/alert" -d "${EmailDestinationList[*]}"
function SendAnEmail { local OPTIND opt DestList while getopts "s:d:" opt do case $opt in s) Subject="$OPTARG" ;; d) DestList+=("$OPTARG") ;; esac done
for i in ${DestList[@]} do echo "" | mail -s "$Subject" $i done }
# Function to copy BINFILES and BITFILES to the right directory # Example 1: CopyToDir -c $CRD -b "$BINFILES" -B "$BITFILES" -d $SaveDir -s jtagx86 -u $HWUser # Example 2: CopyToDir -c $CRD -b "$BINFILES" -B "$BITFILES" -d $SaveDir -s "jtagx86 orpington" -u $HWUser # Example 3: CopyToDir -c $CRD -b "$BINFILES" -B "$BITFILES" -d $SaveDir -s "$IMGServers" -u $HWUser # -b & -B (maybe not -B) should use "" as $BINFILES & $BITFILES are usually lists of files like "primary.bin secondary.bin"
function CopyToDir { local OPTIND opt FPGACard Bin Bit ToDir SSHDest SSHUser while getopts "c:b:B:d:s:u:" opt do case $opt in b) Bin="$OPTARG" ;; B) Bit="$OPTARG" ;; d) ToDir="$OPTARG" ;; c) FPGACard="$OPTARG" ;; s) SSHDest="$OPTARG" ;; u) SSHUser="$OPTARG" ;; esac done
echo " -> Copying $FPGACard bin-file(s) & bit-file(s) images to $ToDir" mkdir -p $ToDir cp -rp $Bin $ToDir echo $Bin if [ "$Bit" != "" ]; then cp -rp $Bit $ToDir; echo $Bit; fi
for i in $SSHDest do echo;echo " -> Copying $FPGACard bin-file(s) & bit-file(s) images to $i:$ToDir" ssh ${SSHUser}@$i "mkdir -p $ToDir" scp -rp $Bin ${SSHUser}@$i:$ToDir if [ "$Bit" != "" ]; then scp -rp $Bit ${SSHUser}@$i:$ToDir; echo $Bit; fi done }
#============================================================================================== # Power Service Layer Simulation Engine (pslse) setup # Should not be used but may be required by ??
echo;echo "*******************************************************************************" echo "J:Getting Power Service Layer Simulation Engine (pslse) Environment ..." echo echo;echo "Current directory is : $PWD" ls -al
echo;echo " -> Deleting old ./pslse (Power Service Layer Simulation Engine) directory" rm -rf pslse
echo;echo "Getting (git clone) Pwoer Service Layer Simulation Environment (pslse) branch=$PSLSE_BRANCH for card=$CRD..." git clone -b $PSLSE_BRANCH https://github.com/ibm-capi/pslse pslse;echo "git clone PSLSE RC=$?"
echo;echo " -> Cleaning (make clean) $SNAP_ROOT & $SNAP_ROOT/hardware/capi2-bsp directories" cd ${SNAP_ROOT} make clean # to make sure we restart from a blank snap

cd ${SNAP_ROOT}
# for all CAPI1 cards we run 2018.1 export VIV_VERSION="2018.1" echo " -> VIVADO version initially set to $VIV_VERSION"
